Increased Stress and Anxiety: The inability to sleep would cause immense stress and anxiety, leading to a breakdown in mental health.
Decreased Productivity: Without sleep, people would not be able to function properly, resulting in decreased productivity and efficiency.
Physical Health Issues: Prolonged sleep deprivation would lead to various physical health issues such as weakened immune system, increased risk of chronic diseases, and decreased reaction time.
Increased Risk of Accidents: Due to the physical and mental impairments caused by sleep deprivation, people would be more prone to accidents and injuries.
Social and Emotional Isolation: People would become increasingly isolated and disconnected from society due to their inability to engage in social interactions and form meaningful connections.
